description: Gooseberries are small, round berries that can be green, yellow, or red when ripe. They have a tart, slightly sweet flavor and are covered in fine hairs. They grow on thorny bushes and are popular in European cuisine.

flavor_profile.notes: Tart with subtle sweetness, becoming sweeter as they ripen

storage_tips: Store unripe gooseberries at room temperature until they reach desired ripeness. Ripe berries can be refrigerated for up to 2 weeks. For longer storage, freeze on a baking sheet, then transfer to freezer bags.
preparation: Wash thoroughly and remove stems and any remaining flower remnants. For jams, can be used whole or halved. The tart flavor makes them excellent for jams when combined with sugar.
